alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 12:22PM EDT until May 20 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHEASTERN ALLEGANY...NORTHWESTERN MORGAN...EAST CENTRAL MINERAL AND NORTH CENTRAL HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES... At 1221 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Inglesmith to near Fort Ashby, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Hancock, Paw Paw, Fort Ashby, Berkeley Springs, Great Cacapon, Green Spring, Oldtown, Spring Gap, Little Orleans, Patterson Creek, Lineburg, Short Gap, Wagoner, Pumpkin Center, North Branch, Magnolia, Forest Park, Bellegrove, Berryville and Levels. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for western and north central Maryland...and eastern and the Panhandle of West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
